did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, and other papers relating to bees and beekeeping.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, and other papers relating to bees and beekeeping. Includes material on the manufacture, patent assignment, alleged patent infringement, and use of royalties of the product made by the Dyce Honey Process; on Nellie J. Stratton's development of a honey and lactose candy; on the coordination of entomologists' research efforts during World War II; on the establishment and growth of the Charles C. Miller Memorial Library; and of the publication of beekeeping journals, pamphlets, and books.

Additional papers include correspondence with other apiologists and entomologists concerning the behavior and raising of bees and improved methods for producing and shipping honey, with the A.I. Root Company of Medina, Ohio, producers of beekeepers' supplies and honey and publishers of Gleanings in Bee Culture, with editors of the American Bee Journal, and with U.S. Representatives Gilbert N. Haugen, Franklin Menges, William L. Nelson, and Gale H. Stalker and Senators Robert F. Wagner, Sr., concerning the opposition of American honey interests to bills (1928, 1930) designed to allow the addition of corn sugars to manufactured products without marking this addition on the label; together with an unpublished ms. by Phillips on the behavior of bees and photograph concerning beekeeping.

Also includes correspondence, 1868-1888; petition relating to adulteration of honey, 1878, and one Japanese fable presented by Marice G. Dadant to Dr. Phillips, 1948, selected by C. P. Dadant and Charles Dadant, previously located in Mann Library, Cornell University.

Correspondents include Charles P. Alexander, Percy N. Annand, Liberty Hyde Bailey, Camille Pierre Dadant, Elton J. Dyce, Livingston Farrand,Albert R. Mann, James G. Needham, Charles E. Palm, Sherman Peer, Franklin D. Roosevelt, Ernest H. Root, Huber H. Root, Nellie J. Stratton, Henry A. Wallace, Sherman Whitney, and many others.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture. Dept. of Entomology.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Everett Franklin Phillips papers, #21-23-768. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

Correspondence with R.F. Remer, Sioux Honey Assn., Sioux City, Iowa, concerning: manufacture of honey under Dyce process by Sioux Honey Assn.; problems of cooperatives for handling honey; release of honey from price regulations. Also correspondence with E.J. Dyce, W.J. Dedicott, S.F. Wadden, Allan H. Treman, G.F. Rogalsky

Correspondence on patent infringements on Dyce Process with Lloyd B. Sherman, V.V. Dexter, Sherman Whitney, C.E. Hamann. Comparison of Lund and Dyce honey processes. Copy of contract with Honey Butter Products Corp. Also correspondence with J.J.C. Downey, G.F. Rogalsky, D.B. Bradshaw, Sherman Peer, L.N. Simmons, Seth J. Shaw

scopecontent.p: Correspondence and reports re development of a honey and lactose candy by Miss Stratton. Mr. James Collins, Blue Moon Cheese Products Co., Messrs. S.F. Whitman and Sons, W. E. Bliss, Pres. The Honey Candy Co. of America, L.A. Beeghley (re patents), Karl Fenning (re Patent), S. Erison, The Honey Candy Co. of America, Fred C. Taylor, The Sugar Institute, Inc., W. Guthrie, Truscon Steel Co., H.P. Weld, Dept. of Psychology, Cornell University

did.unittitle: Mr. Rapheal Gould, American Library Service: re Frans Blom and Edwin C. Alphonsus ms. on beekeeping in Maya civilization

Questions based on A.B. Comstock's book "How to Keep Bees" for use in correspondence course given by Dr. Burton N. Gates, Massachusettes Ag. College. Also questions based on Phillips' book "Beekeeping"
Correspondence re obtaining material on John S. Harbison: Mrs. M.J. Harbison, Mrs. John S. Harbison, Mrs. John C. Taggart, Charles B. Phillips
Letter to Col. Charles A. Lindberg re song written in his honor. Correspondence with M. Charles Louis Loretan re song on beekeeping - words and music included

Miller, E.G. Lestourgeon, Mgr. Texas Honey Producers Assn., Louis H. School, The Beekeepers' Item, H.F. Wilson, S.W. Beyer

scopecontent.p: Letters and reports of Committee on Coordination of Entomology with the War Effort; report on Conference on War Problems in Biology and Agriculture; report on War Activities of Bureau of Entomology and Plant Quarantine; U.S. Dept. of Ag. Report on Ag. Production of 1943.

Correspondence with the following: P.N. Annand, Chief Bureau of Ent., Washington, D.C.; Robert Griggs; C.E. Palm; Dept. of Entomology, Cornell University; Harry B. Weiss, President Am. Assn. Econ. Ent.; F.L. Campbell; C.H. Richardson; Charles P. Alexander, Pres. Ent. Soc. of Am.; F.C. Bishop, Chief Joint Committee on War-Work Training; C.E. Mickel, Ent. Soc. of America; E.O. Essig, professor of Entomology, Univ. of California; John S. Hauser; W.B. Herms, Univ. of California; Ernest N. Cory; H.A. Wallace, Sec., Dept. of Ag.; H.B. Hungerford, Univ. of Kansas; Harold D. Smith, Dir., Bureau of Budget; Avery S. Hoyt, U.S. Dept. of Ag.

did.unittitle: Correspondence re honey grading - H.W. Samson, U.S. Bureau of Ag. Econ., E.P. Norgord, Dept. of Farms and Markets, Albany
Crop Protection Committee reports and correspondence

scopecontent.p: Correspondence with E.C. Stackman, Chairman; Robert F. Griggs, Chairman Div. of Biol. and Ag., Natl. Research Council; Major Gen. Lewis B. Hershey; Dr. J.G. Leach, Acting Chairman, War Emer. Committee; Harry B. Weiss; J.D. Walker, Chairman of Sub-committee on Seed Certification; Ross G. Harrison, Chairman, Natl. Research Council. Also, correspondence with Dr. Walter F. Loehwing and G.W. Keitt, Prof. of Plant Pathology, Univ. of Wisconsin
Mimeo entitled "A Proposal re Ag. Services in Foreign Territories Occupied by American Troops."

Report on meeting of Am. Phytopathological Society, Feb. 13-14, 1943. Report of Fungicide Sub-committee, War Emergency Committee, Am. Phytopathological Society. Memo on the War Problem of Manpower in Plant Pathology

did.unittitle: Correspondence, review, and contract on W.F. Phillips' book "Beekeeping." L.H. Bailey, H.S. Latham, The Macmillan Co., E.A. Elder
Lloyd R. Watson, data on variation in tongue length of progeny of queenbees

Correspondence re patent assignment of Dyce Process to Cornell University; use of royalties; honey prices; building of apiary; complaints of liscenses. Elton J. Dyce, G.F. Rogalsky, Livingston Farrand, A.R. Mann
Canadian patent in Dyce honey process; license agreement. J.B. Fairbairn, Deputy Min. of Ag., F.E. Millen, Ontario Ag. College, E.J. Dyce, Robert V. Morse, M.B. Gordon, Smart and Biggar

Coordination of entomology with war effort; occupational classification bulletin. Correspondence with Ernest N. Cory, A.G. Ruggles, Dr. Leonard Carmichael

Honey bottling business with Preserves and Honey, Inc.; honey experiments. E.R. Root, Huber H. Root

Correspondence (in alphabetical order) concerning collection development efforts at expanding the Everett Phillips Beekeeping Library
